results.title: Effect of Metformin (MTF) Intervention During Pregnancy in Women With Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome (PCOS): A Systematic Review
results.text_hl: Eleven randomized controlled trials (RCTs) with 1,091 @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ found that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MTF@@@ may lower the risk of @<m>DISEASE_Ovarian_Hyperstimulation_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016471 @@@ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Ovarian_Hyperstimulation_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016471 @@@OHSS@@@).

results.title: Lights and shadows on the use of metformin in pregnancy: from the preconception phase to breastfeeding and beyond
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_9606 @@@Women@@@ in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ group had lower odds of @<m>DISEASE_Ovarian_Hyperstimulation_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016471 @@@OHSS@@@ than @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ in the control group (OR 0.43; 95% CI 0.24-0.78); in particular, @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ in the subgroup with BMI > 26 had lower rates of @<m>DISEASE_Ovarian_Hyperstimulation_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016471 @@@OHSS@@@ if randomized with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (OR 0.25, 95% CI 0.12-0.51).

Lights and shadows on the use of metformin in pregnancy: from the preconception phase to breastfeeding and beyond Front Endocrinol (Lausanne). 2023;14():1176623. PMID: 37409227

results.title: Metformin treatment before and during IVF or ICSI in women with polycystic ovary syndrome.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ may reduce the incidence of @<m>DISEASE_Ovarian_Hyperstimulation_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016471 @@@OHSS@@@ but may result in a higher incidence of side effects.

results.title: Comparative efficacy and safety of metformin, anti-obesity agents, and myoinositol in improving IVF/ICSI outcomes and reducing ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome in women with polycystic ovary syndrome: a systematic review and network meta-analysis.
results.text_hl: Network meta-analysis confirmed no significant differences in pregnancy outcomes for these agents compared to controls, though both @CHEMICAL_Inositol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007294 @@@myoinositol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ reduced @<m>DISEASE_Ovarian_Hyperstimulation_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016471 @@@OHSS@@@ risk.

results.title: Women with PCOS who undergo IVF: a comprehensive review of therapeutic strategies for successful outcomes
results.text_hl: Concerning stimulation protocols, antagonist cycles with the judicious use of @GENE_GNRH1 @GENE_2796 @@@GnRH@@@ agonist trigger, pre-treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Vitamin_D @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014807 @@@vitamin D@@@ repletion may help mitigate the accompanied risk of @<m>DISEASE_Ovarian_Hyperstimulation_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016471 @@@ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Ovarian_Hyperstimulation_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016471 @@@OHSS@@@).

results.title: Myoinositol versus metformin pretreatment in GnRH-antagonist cycle for women with PCOS undergoing IVF: a double-blinded randomized controlled study.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: To study the effects of @CHEMICAL_Inositol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007294 @@@myoinositol@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Inositol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007294 @@@Myo@@@) in comparison to @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (@GENE_SLTM @GENE_79811 @@@Met@@@), in reducing the risk of @<m>DISEASE_Ovarian_Hyperstimulation_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016471 @@@OHSS@@@ and improving ART outcome in @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ undergoing @DISEASE_Paroxysmal_ventricular_fibrillation @DISEASE_MESH:C537182 @@@IVF@@@.

results.title: Effectiveness of inositol, metformin and their combination in women with PCOS undergoing assisted reproduction: systematic review and meta-analysis.
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Ovarian_Hyperstimulation_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016471 @@@OHSS@@@ was less in @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (RR = 0.34, 95% CI: 0.17 to 0.69, p = 0.003).
